newsitem.title: HUNGARY: Hungary gives HUF 500mln for small firm investment.
newsitem.headline: Hungary gives HUF 500mln for small firm investment.

text.p: Hungary will spend 500 million forints this year on subsidising investment-oriented loans for small firms, the government said on Thursday.
"The government subsidy will be 25 percent of the central bank base rate," government spokesman Elemer Kiss told a news conference following the weekly cabinet meeting.
He added that the subsidy is applicable to companies with less than 100 employees, for loans under 100 million forints of which at least 70 percent has to be spent on investment.
The government will shortly issue detailed regulations of the loan conditions, a statement said.
